result.reason: Combining the filter (search existing connections) and Quick Connect (connect to new host) fields would conflate two fundamentally different operations — searching vs. connecting — creating UX confusion and requiring major UI redesign with ambiguous input parsing.
result.approach: wontfix — the filter field searches the connection tree while Quick Connect initiates a new session to an arbitrary host; combining them creates ambiguity (is the user searching or connecting?) and would require complex heuristics to distinguish intent, with high risk of accidental connections

attempts.raw_output:
Now I have enough context. The issue is about combining the **search/filter box** (in the connection tree panel) with the **Quick Connect toolbar** (a separate toolbar for ad-hoc connections). This is a significant UX redesign suggestion - merging two distinct UI elements that serve different purposes (filtering existing connections vs. initiating new connections to arbitrary hosts).
